citeinfo.title: Major watershed boundaries for Pennsylvania conservation gap analysis

pubinfo.publish: Pennsylvania Gap Analysis Program. Environmental Resources Research Institute, The Pennsylvania State University

descript.abstract: This polygon layer delineates the boundaries of 8 major watersheds in Pennsylvania that have shown through past vertebrate inventory collection records to effectively separate domains for some species of animals. The basins included are Lake Erie, the Allegheny, Ohio, Monongahela, Susquehanna, Delaware, Potomac and Genessee Rivers.
descript.purpose: Used in the Pennsylvania Gap Analysis for boundaries to facilitate the modelling of vertebrate habitat potential modelling.
